paragraph.paragraph: Sets are containers where successive occurrences of the same item are not distinguished: inserting the same item twice has the same observable effect as inserting it once.
paragraph.heading: 2Deferred classes
paragraph.paragraph:
The most general class describing sets is
../../reference/structures/set/set_chart.html SET . The usual operations of set theory such as union and intersection have been relegated to
../../reference/structures/set/subset_chart.html SUBSET , an heir of
../../reference/structures/set/set_chart.html SET . This enables a class to inherit from
../../reference/structures/set/set_chart.html SET without having to effect these operations if it satisfies the basic set property but has no convenient implementation of the subset operations.
paragraph.heading: 2Sets without a notion of order
paragraph.paragraph:
../../reference/structures/set/linked_set_chart.html LINKED_SET provides a basic implementation of
../../reference/structures/set/set_chart.html SET by linked lists.
paragraph.heading: 2Sets of comparable elements and sorted sets
paragraph.paragraph:
The deferred class
../../reference/structures/set/comparable_set_chart.html COMPARABLE_SET , declared as

describes sets whose items may be compared by a total order relation. The class has the features
../../reference/structures/set/comparable_set.html#f_min min and
../../reference/structures/set/comparable_set.html#f_max max . Two implementations of
../../reference/structures/set/comparable_set_chart.html COMPARABLE_SET are provided. One,
../../reference/structures/set/two_way_sorted_set_chart.html TWO_WAY_SORTED_SET , uses sorted two-way lists. The other,
../../reference/structures/set/binary_search_tree_set_chart.html BINARY_SEARCH_TREE_SET , uses binary search trees. If the items are partially rather than totally ordered, you may use the class
../../reference/structures/set/part_sorted_set_chart.html PART_SORTED_SET [G ->
../../reference/kernel/part_comparable_chart.html PART_COMPARABLE ], which uses a two-way sorted list implementation.
